Title: Indestructible
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2024
Body: I bought these on sale, figuring they‚Äôd be at least decent for the lower price but having pretty low expectations overall. I just needed some bluetooth headphones. I started accidentally abusing them and found out that they are indestructible, and as a nice bonus, they sound nice!I‚Äôve had them for about a year now.‚Ä¢I lost them on the riding lawn mower‚Äîthey were stuck in a thing on the back that I won‚Äôt describe, but they were really hard to get out.‚Ä¢They were in my pocket and went through the washer and dryer, and when they came out, they worked like normal, no difference in sound quality. Just the headphones went through, not the case.‚Ä¢I lose them all the time, either one or the other or the entire case. The battery life is so long that sometimes I can‚Äôt find the case for two days but can still use the headphone (s) that I have with me. Also charges fast.Definitely worth buying. Easy to pair to any device as long as they aren‚Äôt already paired to something else.

Title: Best Earbuds I‚Äôve ever purchased
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
Body: Bought 3 of these 11/2022 (for me, hubby, and daughter). I‚Äôm not a techy person so no technical comments here. The first year having them were great‚Ä¶ super long run time, easy connect to phone, computer and tv, sound was great.  After first year one of my earbuds stopped charging. I cleaned case and earbuds really good but still not working I then dropped the case with earbuds it it then it started to work.  Also for past month even with a full charge, very seldom it would cut off sound quickly.  Last for a couple seconds only. Also my daughter‚Äôs one earbud stopped working. But my husband‚Äôs earbuds have worked perfectly, no issues. For the price and performance I would definitely buy again.

Title: GREAT build quality, BUT .... (UPDATED: Excellent Customer Service!)
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2024
Body: (UPDATE: Right after expressing my concerns with the sound quality, customer service reached out to see how they could help! I added a star because it's REFRESHING when customer service is actually great!)... it's got issues.At the time of writing, I'm writing this review, mostly because this product has SO much promise, but it has two issues that left me disappointed. Also, for preface, I'm a filmmaker who also makes music, so I'd say I have a good ear for sound.First, the good: The build quality is EXCELLENT, especially for the price! It's a bit bigger than some competitors, but it's really light and well-made. The screen is helpful, and the earbuds themselves feel solid. Bluetooth connectivity is straightforward as well!Now, onto my critiques: A smaller one, but still important, but the noise cancelling just doesn't work on this. While it does a good job blocking out sound, I've had friends and family members complain about my microphone when calling. The product actually lists that it has some sort of noise canceling for calls, but it's nothing really special.But that's not my biggest problem.It's just the sound is SO off! Some people might be able to get used to it, but I can't. It was really shocking because the first impressions were great, and I don't get why so many people have reviewed this so positively. As someone who listens to a wide range of music (hip hop, rock, pop, even traditional East Asian music!), the earbuds do a poor job of outputting a clear sound. The mix is REALLY muddy, especially at the low frequencies. Basses really mess up male vocals, and high frequencies are airy. The mids seem completely missing, almost like the inverse of what you'd hear through a phone!If they can just adjust their EQ to sound fuller (and maybe tone down the bass), then these would be INCREDIBLE. Again, I'm SHOCKED that this has as many positive reviews. I'd rather buy $8 wired earbuds over these. This product has HUGE POTENTIAL, but completely WASTED buy the actual sound quality.(And no, I will not be downloading EQ's specifically for these earbuds. I have too many devices)The Tozo T6 (my previous earbuds) are a great alt at this price point (whenever it's on sale at least), but since I wanted to try something new, I'm sticking with the JBL Vibes. They sound great :)

Title: Not bad for the money
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
Body: I originally reviewed these earbuds saying that you couldn't just use one bud without the other one draining it's battery as well, but that's not strictly true (although there is a risk of it).  You need to be mindful not to close it too quickly after taking out the bud you want to use.  As long as you give it a few seconds before closing it, it appears to reliably recharge the other one (it loses a very small amount of power since it was activated upon opening the charger).I didn't have to take this precaution with my old Boltune earbuds, but I couldn't find those online anymore, so I had to try something else (these ones).Aside from the charging issue, which I appear to have resolved, according to people I talk to over the phone, these don't sound as good as my old buds, but people don't seem to have a hard time understanding me.  That said, I don't often hold conversations in loud environments, and so I don't know how well these filter out loud background noise.Still, so far so good.  They're comfortable and they sound pretty good, especially for the price.  In fact, for the price, they're really good.

Title: Ultimate Convenience and Performance in Compact Earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
Body: I've recently discovered the perfect companion for both my active lifestyle and leisure time. these earbuds with a long-lasting battery life, small compact design, and noise reduction feature.These earbuds have truly revolutionized my audio experience. Whether I'm hitting the gym for an intense workout session or simply relaxing at home, they deliver exceptional sound quality while effectively blocking out unwanted noise, allowing me to focus entirely on my music or podcasts.What truly sets these earbuds apart is their long-lasting battery life. I never have to worry about them running out of power, even during extended use throughout the day.Their compact design makes them incredibly convenient to carry around, fitting snugly in my pocket or gym bag without adding any bulk.Overall, I can't recommend these earbuds enough. Title: Great sound with good Bluetooth range
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Body: I've had these ear buds for a couple of months now and can say that I'm pleased with their performance. I wanted an Air Pod style ear bud but didn't want to pay Air Pod prices. I can't compare these to the aforementioned product, but for my needs these fit the bill.Pairing was simple and automatic (I have an Android phone for reference, Samsung Note 10 to be exact). They connect every time to my phone with no issues.The sound is entirely adequate with the treble and bass both coming through clearly and cleanly. I use these at work (CNC machines) and while working outside around my house cutting grass and using various like tools. I never have a problem hearing my music or the spoken word.Bluetooth connectivity and range is good as well. I walked into a different room with multiple obstacles between the ear buds and my phone and the sound never cut out. Distance apart was about 40 feet. I'm sure I could have gone further. I haven't done a formal test of this as of yet. Usually my phone is clipped to my belt or laying just a few feet away so it doesn't cross my mind to be honest.They fit comfortably in my ears and the included charger keeps them ready to go. I can listen to them for at least two 10 hour days before I plug the charger in, but could go longer if I had to.Overall these are good ear buds for not a lot of money. I read the reviews on these before I purchased them to help me make a decision and I hope my review helps someone else make up their mind.

Title: Not bad, Not Bad At ALL!

Body: Super surprised by these.Figured for the price they would be at best less ‚Äútin-treble‚Äù sounding than say, something from a discount store.But, No.The sound quality and Especially the Bass are magnificent!I have fat fingers so, if I Had to say one ‚Äúcon‚Äù for me would be that I have trouble sometimes getting them out of the charging case,‚Ä¶.But Hey, that just means the magnets holding them in are super strong and you definitely wouldn‚Äôt lose one from falling out of the case accidentally.

Title: Great for travel
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
Body: I got these to see if I like this style of earbuds before I spend the money on airpods. I have used these for 2 months now and love them. They fit great, keep a good charge, and have a good sound quality. I travel quite a bit so I think these will be great for travel. Title: Perfect for my use
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
Body: I needed a pair of really Slim and lightweight earbuds as I have narrow ear canals and many of the earbuds don't sit properly. These fit perfectly and are very lightweight and stay in. The sound is excellent in stereo and the voice quality is very good according to the people I have used them with. For music they're okay just don't put it too loud then the music sound distorts. I used it for speaking on the phone hands-free and it is ideal. Works with my tablet as well.

Title: Awesome  earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
Body: These earbuds are awesome. Extremely comfortable and long lasting, these earbuds are some of the best you can find at any price point. I have had to buy several different earbuds over the last few because of durability of case or just wanting something that lasted longer. These earbuds  are awesome, I would recommend these to anyone looking for a good quality  set.

Title: Works fine, tricky tiny controls
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
Body: These do last long after being charged.  I couldn't find my instructions at first for operating play/pause, volume up/down, etc. The controls are super tiny, hang onto the user manual quick start or you could accidentally turn them off or blast the sound.  For transparency sake, I was offered a $15 Amazon card to give a 5 star review.  However, I waited to be sure they deserved it, and so far they have worked well for me.

Title: Very Reliable
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
Body: Love the fact that it always connects and remembers my last connected devie. Tap controls work great and are very helpful while exercising - no need to pull out the phone.  Clear sound, great bass and treble.

Title: High Pitched Noise
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: Unfortunately, I just missed the window to return these 3 days ago. I don't need to use earbuds much, so I hardly got to the 20 hour use mark before experiencing a noise so high pitched that, despite being incredibly quiet, is actually painful for me, and it's constant. The quality seemed nice before then but they don't seem built to last. Still, a pair about $5 less than these has lasted way longer without issues. I wish I hadn't had to retire them so soon..

Title: Absolute Garbage and Amazon Choice?

Paired them with my pc which is like a foot and a half away and if i turn my head to either the left or right the sound  cuts out. Mic quality is on the tin can on a string level of quality. Save your money buy a brand known for quality.Dont trust amazon choice

Title: Very good earbuds, but my right earbud simply stopped functioning after two months

Title: they're meh...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
Body: First they fit so snuggly in the box it's really hard to pull them out. Then they don't fit in the ear well and end up hurting after a short while. And the buttons are too sensitive, the volume keeps changing when one out of my ear.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
Body: I have had these earbuds for one month and they have already quit working.  They are fully charged but will not pair with my phone. I would return them but I missed the return date by 2 days.

Title: Not for my ears, not for calls
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Body: They look nice and really sounded nice for listening to music.  Battery held well, charging cases is nice (small, LED battery status, easy to get buds in/out), and pairs quickly. But I bought these to use for calls, and people couldn‚Äôt hear me well at all, even in a quiet room, and they became uncomfortable in my ears after about a half hour.  Not the rubber changeable piece but the plastic itself dug into my ear and was unpleasant.  Everyone‚Äôs ear is different, so they may fit others better (very different than Apple pod fit, bulkier and sticks out more), and if just for music they would be good.  But ultimately for me, they did not perform well at all on calls.

Title: I guess I'm the odd man out
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: Everyone seems to love how these things stay in their ears, but mine do not stay in at all. I have tried every size of earpiece, and they just do not stay put. The problem is the sound quality is highly dependent on the positioning in the ear canal. So the sound can be rich and full, but will quickly lose bass and become thin as the bud slips out of my ear. Maybe I have weird shaped ears, because I have never ever had a set of earbuds that fit snuggly. I usually use over the ear phones, but wanted something small to carry around with me. For the price, I guess they are fine, but I wont be using these often because of the poor fit.

Title: too sensitive
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2024
Body: These earbuds sound great, and have a good battery life. The main drawback is the sensitivity. They stop and start sporadically, depending on if motion is detected near the earbud. Just removing the earbud from your ear and placing it in your pocket or even on the counter may result in starting the music, and then draining your battery. While wearing them, I can "stop/start" by accidentally raising my arm too close to my ear. It's just too sensitive. I now know I prefer an actual button.

Title: kind of good
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
Body: they last a long time, i always have at least one in all day at school (8hrs) and the one i have in all day only dies on the ride home which is good. they're really uncomfortable tho, my ears are in pain a lot because of them (not because of the cushion size). the volume on the left one keeps decreasing probably because i wear that one by itself a lot but still i don‚Äôt like it. there is an audio delay too.

Title: Would be perfect if it wasn't for one thing
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
Body: My ear buds from a very popular brand stopped working in one ear, and I just didnt feel like spending that much money on some again when I feel like you don't get what you pay for.  So I ordered these based on the reviews.  The sound is great.  Literally like hi definition stereo with nice bass.  Fit is great, very comfortable and stays in my ears at the gym.  My only downside is that everyone I talk to using them, says I am muffled.  I cant figure out why.  I am not hugely disappointment because my main reason to get them was music for the gym, and well, they don't cost much.  If it wasnt for the one issue, I would have probably bought these over and over again.

Title: Noice cancelling was non-existent.  Sound is average IMO.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
Body: It is past the return window, so I have to keep them.  The sound is just "ok".  The highs and voices are clear, but the bass is not what I want or expect.  Now I also have the Soundcore "over the ear" Q30s and maybe I'm just being picky, but the sound/bass on my Sephia wired earbuds and on my Soundcore Q30s are really good.  These don't even get close.  I wore them on a 2 hour flight and the noise cancellation was non-existent compared to my Q30's.  I had to turn them almost all the way up to hear it above the airplane noise.

Title: Hurts ears

Title: AWESOME SOUND, QUALITY AND LOOK.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
Body: I'm 57 so imagine how many ive had over the years starting with the sony walkman so when i say these are really a top 3 pair im telling the truth. I travel a lot for work. I use these all day and they are amazing for the price. Wherever I am I have them in and they are super comfortable and the sound for music comparison to 129 dollar pairs and the look is awesome plus they stay in your ears when you work out. The battery is solid and they last a long time! Amazing!  Another good feature is you can keep one in your ear and one in the charger and it works great.

Title: Exceptional Value and Comfort in Affordable Wireless Earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: I recently stumbled upon a hidden gem on Amazon in the form of wireless earbuds that exceeded all expectations. Priced affordably, these earbuds not only offer an exceptional value for money but also deliver an impressive performance that rivals more expensive alternatives.One of the standout features of these wireless earbuds is their comfort. The design is not only sleek and stylish but also ergonomic, ensuring a snug fit in my ears. The inclusion of multiple ear tip sizes caters to a wide range of ear sizes, providing a customized and comfortable experience for users. Whether you have smaller or larger ears, these earbuds are likely to fit well and stay securely in place.The sound quality is surprisingly robust for earbuds in this price range. The bass is punchy, and the highs and mids are clear, providing an enjoyable listening experience across various music genres. The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless, and I experienced minimal dropouts during use, contributing to an uninterrupted and immersive audio experience.Battery life is commendable, offering extended usage between charges. The compact charging case not only keeps the earbuds protected but also ensures they are always ready for use when needed. This feature is especially convenient for on-the-go individuals who require a reliable audio companion throughout the day.Navigating playback controls is straightforward, thanks to the touch-sensitive surfaces on each earbud. Controlling music playback, answering calls, and activating voice assistants can be done with ease, eliminating the need to fumble with your device.Overall, these wireless earbuds are a great find on Amazon for those seeking an affordable yet high-quality audio solution. Whether you're a music enthusiast or someone who just wants a reliable pair of earbuds for everyday use, these offer a fantastic combination of comfort, functionality, and affordability. I wholeheartedly recommend these earbuds to anyone in search of a budget-friendly audio companion that doesn't compromise on performance.

Comfortable to wear with the 3 different size rubber ear pieces to make them really fit well.  Controls are easy to use.  Instructions are straight forward and complete.  Recommended highly.

LINK HERE: smaate Earbuds Case Compatible Silicon Protective Cover with ‚ÄúS‚Äù Shaped Dual Carabiner, with Window for LED Display (Black) https://a.co/d/8hMmUVsThis display feature ensures you always have a clear idea of the charge level, leaving you worry-free about running out of power during your music sessions. Title: Good for the price!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
Body: I‚Äôve used these daily at work, and they easily last with moderate use during my 10 hour shift.  The sound quality is decent and they are comfortable to wear.  A bonus for me is that they stay put where other brands have not.  Decent quality and price with quick delivery.  I would definitely buy these again.

Title: Phenomenal earbuds!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
Body: Absolutely amazing earbuds for a reasonable price! They hold a charge outside of the case for the majority of my day, charge rather quick, sound great and fit comfortably!

Title: Quality budget alternative for AirPods
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
Body: I was recommended these by a friend who has an Android and has been using these for a few years, I got the white ones and the case is really stylish and lights up to show the charge level. They hold a charge for a long time and work great! I use them in a noisy work environment to listen to music and podcasts, and I can hear everything great. They‚Äôre pretty comfortable and work seamlessly with my iPhone. My husband also has an iPhone and 2 pairs of AirPods and was skeptical at first but then was jealous of the cool way my ear bud case lights up. Definitely a great budget alternative!!!

Title: Stays put, great sound & battery life!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: It has been difficult for me to find a decent pair of earbuds that doesn't have the over the ear hook, that'll stay in place after wearing for more than hour... Until now!I don't like the over the ear hooks because I wear glasses and the ear piece of my glasses puts pressure on the ear hook and after about an hour, the area behind my ear starts to hurt really bad. I've tried several different kinds of ear buds that are supposed to fit snuggly in the ear and not fall out, but after about 30 min, guess what... They start working their way out! One night, I was at work, wearing one of my earbuds and washing dishes. Before I knew it, the earbud slipped out and fell into the dish water. Thank God they were the water proof kind.A few weeks ago, I saw the T12's and thought, what the hell... They were on sale, so I figured I'd give them a shot. There were a few factors involved with making the decision to get these.1. They were on sale. (Who doesn't like to save money?)2. The battery life they claimed to have. I was skeptical about that. 12 to 14 hours, continuous play? The ones I was wearing have a 4 hour battery life, but had magnetic batteries that I could just change out without having to remove the earbud. The first night at work, I fired up my music at around 5p.m. and listened to it for my entire 9 hour shift and on the drive home. I was immediately impressed!3. Stayed put the entire time! After a little while, I could hardly tell that it was there. While I'm working, I only use the left earbud cause I have a headset on my right ear. No more worries about the earbud working loose and falling into the dish water again! One thing I did change was the earbud tip. I replaced the soft silicone tip with a memory foam cushion tip. They aren't cheap, but they are well worth the money.4. Sounds quality is great! No static in the background and the sound is nice and clear. I can actually hear the lyrics!I told myself that I'd give them 2 weeks of use before deciding that they really were all that, or if I was going to have to go back to my search for the perfect earbuds... Again, if in fact, they even existed! Well, the 2 week  trial period is over, and here I am, doing something that I never do! Writing a review for them!Seriously folks, I highly recommend these earbuds. If I could give them more than 5 stars, I would in a heart beat!One thing I am going to do is order another pair of them, as soon as I'm done with this review, to have as back-ups!

Title: Better than Apple...I know, hard to believe
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
Body: I've had Apple air pods pros. Lost them, damaged them. Had 3 pairs total. And they are pretty pricey as you well know and being easy to drop and lose, I started to think are they worth it for the price.I ran into these on Amazon and did my little research. But it never matters until you actually try them yourself. Everything sounded good but now it was time to see if I wasn't going to be let down as they are only $21 and you know the old saying "you get what you pay for ".These IMO beat Apple air pods! What I feared proved to be wrong. The sound quality and bass is very good. The functionality and ease of calling, answer phone calls and playing music is of ease. And one of the top reasons for me personally for getting these is the use of Siri.They exceeded my expectations by far! And the fact that it is over 80% cheaper than Apple air pods is insane! I seriously can't believe the quality.This has to be one of my better purchases on Amazon period!  It's a steal!I've told a few people that these are better than Apple air pods, in my opinion of course. And being that I've had a few Apple airpods, I'm more than qualified to have this opinion.This is one of those products that will be very hard to believe for many. But I truly love that fact that when I'm speaking to someone else on the other line, they can hear me clearly. With my Apple air pods, unfortunately after a while that was always an issue. I know many people can vouch for thatAnd what do you have to lose? They're only about 23 dollars.

Title: Battery Lasts Forever and Great Sound
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
Body: I purchased these wireless earbuds bluetooth headphones on February 8th.  They arrived on the February 9th.I have used these wireless earbuds almost every day and I still have 50% of the battery life to go!  I have used them for calls, on planes with movies and tv shows, listening to podcasts and programs while I am running and they are still going strong.I had purchased a similar pair months ago and they have stayed on my desk as these new wireless earbuds just keep running!I did not think that any set of earbuds could continue to be used without charging them.  I decided to write this review now as I honestly do not know when they will run out of battery!

Title: Unusable after about five uses
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
Body: I bought these earbuds as a second pair because I really liked my first pair. I work on my car a lot so I'm battery dies I don't want to have to wait for my earbuds to recharge. I used these four or five times and one earbud fell on the floor and one of the little metal charging connectors in the bottom of the earbud disappeared and they have been unusable since. I do like my other pair but super bummed that my backup ones are toast!

Title: Good Earbuds, BUT....
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
Body: SUPER DISAPPOINTED...I absolutely loved these earbuds for about 3 weeks. Especially for the price, the sound was good, and the noise cancellation was good. The battery life-- AMAZING. I used them 1-2 hours every day, and the battery lasted nearly 2 weeks. Honestly, this is the only reason that I gave these earbuds 2 stars instead of just one.The problem was....I had one fall out of my ear and land on the ground from height of only about 5 feet. After that, the sound in that one earbud nearly disappeared. I expected (and still expect) an earbud to withstand at least a few 4-5 foot falls without failing. Now, I have spent $30 on earbuds that only lasted me 3 weeks. NOT WORTH IT!

Title: Weird Glitches and Shape
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: I purchased these primarily for use in the gym and at work, and they do get the job done for the most part. Two main issues I have is the shape of the bud itself is a little odd- if you are sitting upright they are mostly fine, but will fall out any time I tilt or bend forward. Not a huge deal for work, but definitely not ideal for the gym. Another weird issue I have found is when receiving an incoming call, the voice bot will say ‚Äúincoming call. re-dowling. re-dowling. re-dowling‚Äù over and over again, which is super irritating. Unsure if this issue pertains only to my specific pair or if it is a system wide programming issue.

Title: Doesn't stay in ears.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: It says it has long hours or playtime but even when the case is displaying a high level of power, the headpieces are saying "power low" repeated until they shut off shortly after. Then, the pieces don't stay in your ears AT ALL!!!! I had to repeatedly push them back in to avoid them falling out altogether or me losing them. I would not recommend this buy.

Title: Short life.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Body: Maybe for others they will last longer, but I have gone through probably 5 pairs of earbuds in the past year. These are one of those pairs. After a short time one earbud just started losing volume. Now I cant hear anything from it, and it is not earwax. I have another pair that was more expensive, but hopefully they will last longer.

Title: üëéüèº

Body: I thought i was getting a great deal on $80 headphones but nope. These look almost just like the $20 headphones from Walmart. They look nothing like the pic and look very cheap.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
Body: I own several pairs of Bluetooth earbuds but liked the design of these. I was very disappointed that they would connect to my iPhone 13 Pro but the only control that worked was the volume. It would not answer phone calls or pause music or podcast playback or advance to the next "track." I returned the earbuds.

Body: These were ok, until the return window closed! Now they make a high pitched whining noise that I cannot believe is good for my ears! Also, they say they work for smaller ears and yet they really don't as they fall out of my ears constantly!

Title: Faulty connections
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
Body: The sound is decent quality. There is a consistent loss of volume while streaming with tv. You may only miss the first 10 seconds of the audio when a video starts or it doesn't start at all. I'm talking every video and every commercial. Very disappointed.

Title: Survived going through a wash and dry cycle
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024

I put back together let it dry out for a few extra days then put back in the charging case and surprisingly the ear bud still works like it did on day one. So I would have to say this brand is pretty durable.

Otherwise the sound is comparable to $100+ earbuds and they fit well!!!

Title: Awesome

Title: sound quite good. the size a little bit big

In highly competitive environment, such as at work, I probably want to use one that is a smaller size. Because, people say, don't judge a book by its cover, but the reason they say it is that, people always judge you.

Title: Too Much Bass?
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
Body: If there‚Äôs such thing as TOO much bass I think this is it. If you want hard hitting, buy these!! Highs are a bit drowned out by the lows. If you like more balanced music these might. It be for you. If you want hard hitting bass you can‚Äôt go wrong here!

Title: Great sound!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: Great sound, very comfortable, and easy to use. Only issue I have is that the display on the case seems to not work correctly. It was stuck at 84 even after charging the case for 10 minutes, and then also after using the earbuds for a while and sticking them back in the case for a bit, still stuck at 84%.

Title: The greatest thing about it is also the worst thing about it

Title: AWESOME SOUND, QUALITY AND LOOK.

Title: Exceptional Value and Comfort in Affordable Wireless Earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: I recently stumbled upon a hidden gem on Amazon in the form of wireless earbuds that exceeded all expectations. Priced affordably, these earbuds not only offer an exceptional value for money but also deliver an impressive performance that rivals more expensive alternatives.One of the standout features of these wireless earbuds is their comfort. The design is not only sleek and stylish but also ergonomic, ensuring a snug fit in my ears. The inclusion of multiple ear tip sizes caters to a wide range of ear sizes, providing a customized and comfortable experience for users. Whether you have smaller or larger ears, these earbuds are likely to fit well and stay securely in place.The sound quality is surprisingly robust for earbuds in this price range. The bass is punchy, and the highs and mids are clear, providing an enjoyable listening experience across various music genres. The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless, and I experienced minimal dropouts during use, contributing to an uninterrupted and immersive audio experience.Battery life is commendable, offering extended usage between charges. The compact charging case not only keeps the earbuds protected but also ensures they are always ready for use when needed. This feature is especially convenient for on-the-go individuals who require a reliable audio companion throughout the day.Navigating playback controls is straightforward, thanks to the touch-sensitive surfaces on each earbud. Controlling music playback, answering calls, and activating voice assistants can be done with ease, eliminating the need to fumble with your device.Overall, these wireless earbuds are a great find on Amazon for those seeking an affordable yet high-quality audio solution. Whether you're a music enthusiast or someone who just wants a reliable pair of earbuds for everyday use, these offer a fantastic combination of comfort, functionality, and affordability. I wholeheartedly recommend these earbuds to anyone in search of a budget-friendly audio companion that doesn't compromise on performance.

Title: Quality budget alternative for AirPods

Body: I was recommended these by a friend who has an Android and has been using these for a few years, I got the white ones and the case is really stylish and lights up to show the charge level. They‚Äôre pretty comfortable and work seamlessly with my iPhone. My husband also has an iPhone and 2 pairs of AirPods and was skeptical at first but then was jealous of the cool way my ear bud case lights up. Definitely a great budget alternative!!!

Title: Stays put, great sound & battery life!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: It has been difficult for me to find a decent pair of earbuds that doesn't have the over the ear hook, that'll stay in place after wearing for more than hour... Until now!I don't like the over the ear hooks because I wear glasses and the ear piece of my glasses puts pressure on the ear hook and after about an hour, the area behind my ear starts to hurt really bad. I've tried several different kinds of ear buds that are supposed to fit snuggly in the ear and not fall out, but after about 30 min, guess what... They start working their way out! One night, I was at work, wearing one of my earbuds and washing dishes. Before I knew it, the earbud slipped out and fell into the dish water. Thank God they were the water proof kind.A few weeks ago, I saw the T12's and thought, what the hell... They were on sale, so I figured I'd give them a shot. There were a few factors involved with making the decision to get these.1. They were on sale. (Who doesn't like to save money?)2. The battery life they claimed to have. I was skeptical about that. 12 to 14 hours, continuous play? The ones I was wearing have a 4 hour battery life, but had magnetic batteries that I could just change out without having to remove the earbud. The first night at work, I fired up my music at around 5p.m. and listened to it for my entire 9 hour shift and on the drive home. I was immediately impressed!3. Stayed put the entire time! After a little while, I could hardly tell that it was there. While I'm working, I only use the left earbud cause I have a headset on my right ear. No more worries about the earbud working loose and falling into the dish water again! One thing I did change was the earbud tip. I replaced the soft silicone tip with a memory foam cushion tip. They aren't cheap, but they are well worth the money.4. Sounds quality is great! No static in the background and the sound is nice and clear. I can actually hear the lyrics!I told myself that I'd give them 2 weeks of use before deciding that they really were all that, or if I was going to have to go back to my search for the perfect earbuds... Again, if in fact, they even existed! Well, the 2 week  trial period is over, and here I am, doing something that I never do! Writing a review for them!Seriously folks, I highly recommend these earbuds. If I could give them more than 5 stars, I would in a heart beat!One thing I am going to do is order another pair of them, as soon as I'm done with this review, to have as back-ups!

Title: Ultimate Convenience and Performance in Compact Earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
Body: I've recently discovered the perfect companion for both my active lifestyle and leisure time. these earbuds with a long-lasting battery life, small compact design, and noise reduction feature.These earbuds have truly revolutionized my audio experience. Whether I'm hitting the gym for an intense workout session or simply relaxing at home, they deliver exceptional sound quality while effectively blocking out unwanted noise, allowing me to focus entirely on my music or podcasts.What truly sets these earbuds apart is their long-lasting battery life. Title: Great sound with good Bluetooth range
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Body: I've had these ear buds for a couple of months now and can say that I'm pleased with their performance. I wanted an Air Pod style ear bud but didn't want to pay Air Pod prices. I can't compare these to the aforementioned product, but for my needs these fit the bill.Pairing was simple and automatic (I have an Android phone for reference, Samsung Note 10 to be exact). They connect every time to my phone with no issues.The sound is entirely adequate with the treble and bass both coming through clearly and cleanly. I use these at work (CNC machines) and while working outside around my house cutting grass and using various like tools. I never have a problem hearing my music or the spoken word.Bluetooth connectivity and range is good as well. I walked into a different room with multiple obstacles between the ear buds and my phone and the sound never cut out. Distance apart was about 40 feet. I'm sure I could have gone further. I haven't done a formal test of this as of yet. Usually my phone is clipped to my belt or laying just a few feet away so it doesn't cross my mind to be honest.They fit comfortably in my ears and the included charger keeps them ready to go. I can listen to them for at least two 10 hour days before I plug the charger in, but could go longer if I had to.Overall these are good ear buds for not a lot of money. I read the reviews on these before I purchased them to help me make a decision and I hope my review helps someone else make up their mind.

Title: Great earbuds for the price!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
Body: I love these and especially for the price!!! I have spent so much money on more expensive brands and they failed to work properly over and over.  But these are amazing!!! My only drawback to 6 stars is if they are paired to my iPad and I want to jump on the bath to listen to music on my phone, I can‚Äôt pair them to my phone until I unpair them from my iPad.  Otherwise the sound is comparable to $100+ earbuds and they fit well!!!

Title: Best Wireless Earbuds!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
Body: I‚Äôve always went through many pairs of AirPods which are well over 100$. My last pair got ruined in the washer so I decided to try a cheaper route. These earbuds blew my expectations away, same type of feel as airpods, quality of sound is great, affordable, and durable. I accidentally washed them in the washer and they still work great. The charge has lasted a few weeks without charging them also.I‚Äôll definitely be buying again!

Title: I was very surprised and pleased with the sound quality.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
Body: I bought it as a birthday gift for my nephew and he loved it so much I bought one for myself. It fits in my ear and doesn't keep falling out like my previous air bud. It's convenient to carry around in my purse.

Title: Pleasantly surprised!!!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
Body: I needed some earbuds for listening to my show while feeding my baby - I didn't want to spend a lot of money because I knew I wouldn't use them a lot. But I am so surprised. Those earbuds are comfortable in my ear, they are really well made, they show you how much battery you have and I haven't charged them yet and they're still working after several weeks. I use them about 2 h every night. 100% recommend.

Title: Luckylindy
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
Body: This is like "as the world turns" ---a melodrama on steroids. It was also written with too much narration ---not enough description from each of the characters' own voices. In other words,not enough spoken dialogue .Oprah's book club missed the boat on this one.  I gave it two stars only because it shows how all families van love and hurt each other so deeply.

Title: Oprah made this a bestseller
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
Body: This book is not worth all the hype. I don't get it. It was so predictable. I had a hard time forcing myself to read it. I saw where the plot was going very early on. This reminds me of a Colleen Hoover book.  A very easy read with a predictable plot. No thanks.  It's also hard to read a book where you don't like the main character. Actually, I couldn't connect with any of the characters but Julia was so especially unlikeable. Completely self absorbed and selfish. I expected more.

Title: Disappointed with the ending
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
Body: This started out interesting with tregards to William‚Äôs story relating to basketball. The story never really got off the emotional ground and became tedious. I almost gave up on it twice. I was expecting a real emotional tear jerking ending with an in-depth conversation between William and Alice. It just ended flat.

Title: This is NOT a modern ‚ÄúLittle Women‚Äù‚Äînot by a longshot
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
Body: What false advertising to claim that this is an update on Little Women, when the main protagonist is a dull MALE who somehow manages to fascinate TWO of the sisters over the course of the novel. If you make a claim to update a classic (as in Demon Copperhead, a book I didn‚Äôt love for much different reasons), you better have your structure in place and be way female-forward. And I say this as a curmudgeonly old male reader who loves 19th century novels.

Title: Seriously overrated book
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
Body: The plot is ridiculous: a young woman who allegedly adores her three sisters realizes she made a mistake in choosing a husband so, unwilling to deal with her husband's mental health crisis, walks out on her entire family.  Then, furious about the relationship one of her sisters (who is, unrealistically, practically beatified) develops with her ex once she's left town, she refuses to maintain contact or allow her daughter to have contact with any of them for more than 20 years.  Oddly -- and unsuccessfully -- the author attempts to portray this detestable character sympathetically.  It's readable, but ultimately unsatisfying.

Title: Disappointing
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
Body: I am frankly amazed at the glowing reviews this book is getting from professional reviewers, other novelists and readers. It is tedious, the plot is poorly paced and the characters are one dimensional. Nothing about this book engaged my imagination. I only persisted in reading it to the end because it was what I brought on vacation. Did Oprah choose this because it is set in Chicago? I expect the theme of recovery from a severe mental health crisis played a part in her choosing it and that aspect of the book is the reason I am giving it two stars rather than the one it otherwise deserves.

Title: It went on and on and on‚Ä¶.I couldn't finish it.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2023
Body: Currently on page 239. Egads. If I have to read one more passage about how holding hands with William made Sylvie all warm inside, I think I might be the one walking into a lake. Well written (except for the author's need to describe the pining Sylvie over and over and over...and the milk toast William who just tood whatever came his way, long suffering....), but looooooooong. So many pages.  And I didn't miss it when I put it down. I don't NOT finish many books, but this was one of them.

Title: Cared about the characters but hated the writing
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
Body: I found this book painfully overwritten. There were so many moments of telling, not showing‚Ä¶and so many moments I cringed or rolled my eyes. I did care about the characters but I couldn‚Äôt wait for the book to be over. I baffled by the book‚Äôs success.

Title: Meh
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
Body: Because Hello Beautiful was Oprah's 100th pick, and I enjoyed Dear Edward, I expected this to be a very satisfying read, but I found it boring from start to finish. The author describes the characters throughout rather than letting their thoughts and actions define them, which may be why they all seemed flat and I felt no connection to any of them. Being one of four sisters myself, I should have related at least to the relationships between the sisters. They are a highly disfunctional family that drags on to include three generations which I should have cared about, but didn't. Wasted time.

Title: Disappointing story
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
Body: This is a depressing book about dysfunctional people and families who both love and hate each other.

Title: Read for Book Club
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2024
Body: Interesting but not an easy read for me and most likely would not have read on my own.

Title: Families like this one I know.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
Body: Growing up with three sisters and one brother I can so relate to this book. It is a difficult story of pain, loss and reconciliation but well written and intriguing enough to capture the reader.  It takes us deep into the characters personal transformations and historical celebrations and it surprises you occasionally. I enjoyed it and would recommend it.

Title: A slow paced read, but heartwarming overall
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: This book is not a page turner by any means. I found myself a little bored at time while reading. The overall story line kept me engaged and I enjoyed reading it overall.

Title: beautiful :)
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: I felt like the first half of the book was slow. The second half was amazing. The end was truly beautiful.

Title: slow burn
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
Body: Overall I ended up really loving the end of the book and themes conveyed. It took a lot of time to figure out which characters to love and which characters to eventually forgive.However I really struggled with the first 1/3-1/2 of the book. The set up dragged out a bit for me and I was wondering if I would ever finish this book! I just couldn‚Äôt fall in love with the main characters and the descriptions of the characters‚Äô lives felt dreary and hard to read. I blazed through the second half surprisingly. If you can get past the first 1/3 I would say it‚Äôs worth finishing! A good book for those who want to enter a family and the messiness of it all. It‚Äôs filled with a slow drama feel to it through the lens of a handful of characters. I wouldn‚Äôt directly parallel it to Little Women, which may have been why I felt led astray in the beginning to be honest.

Title: tugs at the heart
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Body: This contemporary take on "Little Women" tugs at the heart.  Telling the stories that make for a multi-generational, multi-perspective family saga, this book, at its core, looks at what defines a 'family" - love - while looking at more modern subjects including generational trauma, suicide, prejudice and ignorance.  Loved the way Ann Napolitano weaves everything into a cohesive, beautiful story with relatable characters that seem all too familiar at times.  Definitely a book to read on a long weekend, a vacation, or in a book club.

Title: nice story- not great, just good
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
Body: Good book-not stellar but worth a read. I give it a B/B plus.  Fast read and easy to follow. Surprised it was an Oprah book.

Title: Beautiful and heartaching
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
Body: The Padavona sisters all have vastly different personalities; high achieving Julia, bookish romantic Sylvie, artsy and stubborn Cecilia and selfless nurturing Emeline; but their bond is seemingly unbreakable. William Waters, lost and introverted, grew up in a wildly different household, where overwhelming grief over the loss of his sister took hold of his parents‚Äô lives, leaving him to fend for himself.When Julia meets William she is determined to become his wife and create the husband she‚Äôs always dreamed of, making him a project of sorts. He isn‚Äôt exactly sure where he fits into her plan or her family, and when tragedy strikes, the family‚Äôs bond is stretched to its limits.While it is a contemporary take on the classic Little Women, it‚Äôs absolutely its own magnificent story. It‚Äôs a beautiful but heavy and emotional read as each character‚Äôs story unfolds, and your heart aches as you find a place for each of them there.

Title: Nice story
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: Nice story

Title: Beautiful Ending
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
Body: It was a bit slow at times and the suddenly sped through many years.  This made some of the characters a bit more surface than I‚Äôd like.  BUT the ending was beautiful.  Life is indeed a series of beginnings and endings but those endings don‚Äôt cease to exist because their earthly time has been extinguished.  Lovely thoughts on familial relationships and the choices we sometimes make to save the ones we love.

Title: sisters bond
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
Body: This is a story of how love will always bring you back home. It‚Äôs a wonderful example to show the true bond of siblings.

Title: interesting tale of family love.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
Body: Very well and interestingly written. Four sisters with strong personalities and an even stronger love for each other grow and change against a landscape of love and pain.

Title: beautiful, like the title
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Body: Modern Day Little Women.  A beautiful story of life, love, and tragedy. I gave 4 rather than 5 stars because I found the book a bit tedious at the mid point.

Title: Book about family.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
Body: This is a really well written story that deals with the hardships and complexities of family. The characters are flawed, but also are very strong. It is a heavy story, with many over arching themes such as death, marriage, depression, love, and deception. Really well written, some sentences really stand out beautifully. I enjoyed it!

Title: Emotional Rollercoaster
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
Body: I had moments where I really liked this book and moments where I was bored. Overall, I think the author really tapped into emotions and made me feel the characters. Some parts felt far fetched but I am glad I read it and I would recommend giving it a shot.

Title: It drags sometimes
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
Body: Good story. Engaging characters. Repetitive descriptions of events or feelings. It was easy to dislike Rose and Julia at times. The other characters embodied what family should be. Thanks for Kent's continued support.

Title: Messy families everywhere
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
Body: Started choppy for me. But as the characters developed I felt like the writing did too.I love the idea of the big messy imperfect relationships that truly make up a family.I‚Äôm curious about the relationship to Little Women. I might have to finally read that.Started slow but really grew on me!

Title: good book
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
Body: I really enjoyed this book. I felt like it could have moved a bit faster but over all it was a great read.

Title: Uneventful but Surprising
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
Body: This book definitely dragged for much of the time but it pulled together the straggled pieces at the end & what was sad became a loving ending.

Title: Hard to get through some parts
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
Body: I did like this book, but I had to put it down several times because it made me sad. I needed to stop reading for a few hours or even a day so that I could gather myself before continuing. I won‚Äôt go into the plot as so many other reviewers already have, but I will say that the characters were richly drawn, and you do eventually care about each and every one. The novel drags a bit, but if you stick with it you‚Äôll discover new and interesting events that hold you to it.  I have to say that the last hour or two of reading will stir up many emotions, and I cried a lot during that time. William‚Äôs character is the one that affected me the most, and I don‚Äôt think too many people will not be affected by him.  Even through the tears and sadness I experienced reading it, I think it‚Äôs worth the read.

Title: Boring and Childish
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
Body: After reading 50+ pages, I found this book so boring and childish, I quit reading it.

Title: Overrated
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
Body: Like Lessons in Chemistry, this is a highly lauded book of recent years that didn't enthrall me. William is poorly drawn and the love among the sisters, while touching, felt forced. I didn't enjoy this at all.

Title: The ending
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
Body: The ending sucked. I was along for the ride until Alice went to meet her dad. Fake. Fake. Fake. Fake.

Title: insipid
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
Body: The outline of the story is compelling, but the characters and their relationships don‚Äôt seem real. They make a series of decisions that are implausible based on an amateurish psychology lesson that runs rampant throughout the story. This is an idealized depiction of the sisterhood which gets cloyingly insipid, while brainless, emotionally blocked parents make dumb choices in the treatment of their own children.

Title: Don't waste your time
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2023
Body: William Walters was always invisible to his parents who never showed any interest in him. When he meets Julia in college, his life would change. He not only became his best friend but also the doors of her family were opened to him and he had great relationships with her two sisters. The three sisters were very different and William found it very difficult to lead a happy life because of all his childhood trauma. i found the book very boring, predictable, and nothing outstanding to speak about. Once again, a best-seller driven by advertising.

Title: Slow and no plot, hate this book
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
Body: It is painful to read this book.  I have read a third or more of this book.  I only read it when my kindle battery is dead.  It starts out about a young man and his family life, the girl he meets and then you're off to another character.  There is no plot or direction to this book.  It's like someone giving a description or recap of one character then the next. Waste of money, space and landfill.

Title: an Uninspiring story devoid of interesting people.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
Body: A monotonous psychological saga of 4 sisters that dragged on and on with no excitement, mystery, or interesting plot to support it.  I identified with no one nor did I get emotionally involved or stirred by any of the characters.  Even the end was flat and unsatisfying.  I was so glad when I read the last page and it was finally over.  I am amazed that this was a best seller but the days of Gone With the Wind are really gone.

Title: Hard no--sorry
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
Body: I acknowledge that this writer uses language beautifully, and that she weaves an engrossing story.  But I was so depressed by the poor decisions from these characters, by the wasted relationship s that might have been, that I didn't enjoy it at all.

Title: Not a fan of third person narration
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
Body: I am not a fan of third-person narration and find it difficult to read books with that type of narration.

Title: Damaged book
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: Unfortunately the book arrived broken and water damaged.

Title: Fabulous
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2024
Body: You will think about this book long after you have read it! It is thought provoking and it will cause you to look for and try to find what are the dysfunctions in your own family.

Title: A ‚Äúreal‚Äù tale of life
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
Body: A thoughtful look at the fragile nature of life & love through the lens of a family. A family with four sisters growing up with love, heartache, dysfunction & normal ups & downs on the roller coaster ride we call life. Very relatable to all.

Title: Hope
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2024
Body: This family will remind readers that there is hope in relationships that seem hopeless.  Opinions generated about characters change with each chapter.  Well worth the time to read.

Title: Heartwarming
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
Body: In the beginning it took me time to want to continue to read but I think my turning point was when Julia made these plans for her life and others and felt compelled to be in charge of everything. This book had everything from loss,grief,love,attempted suicide, lies, honesty, and clarity. It really was riveting and really had me feeling things that was relatable. It is never too late to make connections or forgive.

Title: so many tears.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
Body: I think I‚Äôve given one other 5 star rating in my life. This book was beautiful, whole, + everything I‚Äôve ever wanted in a book.

Title: One of the best books I‚Äôve read
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2024
Body: I loved the story of these four sisters and how fiercely they loved each other!  It did remind me of ‚ÄúLittle Women‚Äù, especially with all the sobbing it caused me to do. I highly recommend it!

Title: very entwining novel about a family and their lives
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Body: I liked the book very much. Reading it makes me think about my own family. I was an only child but my mom had 8 brothers and sisters that I was very close to. There were always dramas happening.

Title: Buy it!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
Body: My wife LOVED this book. IT was one of the best she ever read. She hopes they make a movie out of it.

Title: just excellent.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: This is not the type of novel I usually read. But, it was truly a great story of life and love.  I am glad I read, in one day I might add, couldn‚Äôt put it down.

Title: Touching chaos
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
Body: Love is messy, love makes us whole, the more love we give the more we receive, there is no such thing as too much love, Love is the overarching theme of this book. The love of parents, siblings, couples and friends.

Title: worst book I've tried to read
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
Body: This book contrives the plot to fit "characters"  instead of the other way to build a story...this seems to be the new "novel" way to write fiction? These characters exist in this book but there is no substance to why and who they are, it is obvious from the start that there is going to be "startling" behavior coming up but the why, the depth, is missing. Let me go back to the books of my earlier life and get back to reading about real people who have real reasons for their story. If I could give this book a minus instead of a 1 would.

Title: Trite
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
Body: If Hallmark Cards wrote books, this would be one of them. Predictable plot and characters, sentimentality abounds. Tedious to get through.

Title: Exactly what all the other one star reviews state
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
Body: In a word, trite.Flat, one dimensional characters, who are not at all brought to life.  I‚Äôm perplexed and troubled by how many good reviews this book has gotten.  I‚Äôve never read anything else by Ann Napolitano, but after reading this, I‚Äôm baffled that she is an established author. This seems like it could have been written by a teenager.  There was zero emotional resonance for me. After a certain point I just skimmed the pages to get through it, thinking ‚Äúblah blah blah‚Äù.  Wish I hadn‚Äôt wasted my money and time.

Title: Never goes anywhere.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
Body: I tried so hard to finish this book but just could not. I kept hoping it would have something to say but it just kept repeating and never had any depth to its characters. I have sisters and I was hoping for some connection with the women in this book and my life but not a chance. These women lived in my time span near my hometown but it felt like they were in 1920. I kept trying to picture the timeframe with the story line and it never felt connected.

Title: Boring
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
Body: I didn‚Äôt like the book at all , so boring and uninteresting

Title: Boring until the last 10 chapters
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
Body: I did not have any connection with these characters. I think it is a poorly written book as was Dear Edward!  Who knew that it was really about a broken basketball player? Wanted to skip to the end with both of these books!  This is not Literary Fiction at its best. If I had known these two books were by the same author I would not have purchased this one. Did I cry at the end, YES. But I cry at stupid movies also!

Title: Book Pages Torn and Bent
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
Body: I just received it last night and opened it this morning into my disappointment. The first pages are bent and torn. I am unlike others that I like to buy my books because I like to keep what I read (I do not rent from the library) and I handle them w/ care. To me this is unacceptable and I need a new book without these damages.And I need it for my book clb

Title: Disappointing: Strong start. Laborious, Predictable Pivot. Cheap, Unsatisfying Ending. Waste of Time
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Body: After a strong start, the author took nearly 200 pages to make a painful, predictable pivot.  Then, as though she was ‚Äúon deadline‚Äù to finish the book, Napolitano wraps things up with a cheap, unsatisfying ending.  Ann Napolitano is no Ann Patchett, that‚Äôs for sure.  A waste of my time.

Title: The cover was torn
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
Body: I had planned to give this book as a gift but will just keep it as it was not in a presentable condition to gift.

Title: Repetitive and boring
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
Body: This book should have been edited down to remove some of the hundreds of repetitions old the same themes. I kept reading it, looking for the reasons the book is on so many recommended reading lists, but, throughout, I was bored and disappointed.

Title: Oh where to begin. ‚Äî-DO NOT READ SPOILERS AHEAD
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
Body: I am one of 4 sisters and life isn‚Äôt exactly like this.  We were @ 5 years after their post but‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.thending about sent me over the edge.  So,,,,, you decide you have met your dream husband.  Then you get pregnant, have a baby, get divorced and stay in NYC.  Of course after the divorce ,your husband ,meets his dream lover- your sister.  So‚Ä¶. Your husband and sister are married and then sister dies.  His exwife- his sister in law- comes back into his life‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ugh

Title: Puzzler
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
Body: I had a hard time with this book.  Despite it being very successful I waited a long time to read it. I know it's a novel  but it just didn't click or ring true. I could hardly wait until it was over.

Title: Sooooo predictable
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
Body: I will start by saying I have not quite finished the book, but I cannot believe this is an Oprah pick.  It is engaging enough that I will finish it, but also so predictable and some of it is flat out unbelievable.  William's parents are so devastated by losing their other child that they develop full on hatred towards William.  Rose refuses to speak to her daughter for following in Rose's own footsteps.  At the beginning of the book all she cared about was making sure her girls were strong, educated, self-sufficient women and then boom, suddenly decides she does not need them in her life and moves away.  The biggest disappointment of all though is the ridiculous "powerful love story" between William and Sylvie which you could see coming from a mile away although not for any reason that made sense.  He tries to kill himself, she decides at that moment she is in love, they have nothing in common and nothing about their dreary little lives feels big or important, it just seems like two sad people who found and clung onto each other.  And then of course we get the answer to the question I knew to expect from the beginning.  Which of these not very exciting characters will die to pull at our heart strings.  Eye roll.

Title: ok but too Hallmark moments for me
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
Body: It was nicely written in places, but I didn‚Äôt find the plot believable or many of the characters likable or fleshed out enough to be interesting. I got bored half way through and kept envisioning it written as if it was intended to be a Hallmark movie: superficial, overwrought, emotionally manipulative, predictable, and melodramatic.

Title: Not great
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
Body: I had high hopes but the story was strange, the main male character kept crying and all the sisters slept entwined. Not my cup of tea.

Title: William comes from a loveless childhood and family.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
Body: He meets and falls for Julia. Her grandiose plans will bring him all the happiness he will ever need, right?Liked, but did not love this book.

Title: Not As Interesting As  Expected
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Body: I can relate to this somewhat, but it is not my favorite book. It is not as well written as I expected.

Title: Low on character development
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
Body: I Didn‚Äôt care for the repetitive memories that just seemed to say the same thing over and over and over.

Title: Book club book
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
Body: We rated it a 3 out of 5.It read like a soap opera.

Title: Highs and a low
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
Body: Hello Beautiful is a contradiction. The last two chapters are fabulous! The beginning ones are good. The middle however, well, just skim the middle of this book. There is slows to a such a standstill that I stopped reading this book. Almost a DNF, but am glad I finally returned to it. Wonderfully written ending.

Title: Not all that great
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
Body: Because it‚Äôs an Oprah book choice, a Barack Obama favorite, and highly praised by Washington Post and New York Times critics, I couldn‚Äôt wait to read Hello, Beautiful. After all I loved Napolitano‚Äôs Dear Edward and Hello, Beautiful has been called a ‚Äúhomage to Louisa May Alcott‚Äôs timeless classic‚Äù Little Women. That‚Äôs just plain wrong. It‚Äôs not even in the same stratosphere as that beloved book. While I like Little Women, I don‚Äôt love it like my daughter-in-law does. After being disappointed, I passed my copy of Hello, Beautiful to her to see what I was missing. She agreed it was similar in that it was a family saga about four very close sisters and the young man who comes into their lives, but it should not be compared to Little Women. My daughter-in-law gave it only 2 stars out of 5. We both agreed that in a large part of the book, particularly the middle, readers spend too much time inside the minds of the characters. As another critic explained Napolitano needs to show us, not tell us. Because of this, the novel became repetitive and kind of a slog fest. The book is not horrible, but it‚Äôs not the great book I expected.

Title: Disappointed
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Body: Really wanted to like this book after all the hoopla but the characters were weak and not believable. The main character of the book William was almost invisible throughout. The author gave us no ending , as if she just stopped writing and walked away.

Title: Writing is slow and tedious
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
Body: This book has many great quotes to reflect on. The writing is stylish, though slow and tedious. The story really doesn‚Äôt get going until the last quarter. I think you could skip to the halfway point and miss nothing at all.

Title: In depth study of a family of sisters
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
Body: This is an incredibly thorough look into the minds and workings of a family of four sisters growing up in Chicago late -mid 20th century (prior to the tech boom).  I liked the writing style which  easily drew me into the character's psyches and I was quickly hooked on wanting to know what would happen to them.  The oldest sister is intent on mapping her future, like a scientist with laser- focused determination and wearing blinders. We learn about each character via chapters told from first-person perspective.This book is a deep character study of a family, with so little plotline beyond that of how they grow as they age and what happens to them as a result of their personal and conjoined perspectives that  I eventually grew weary of the narrow focus, so rich in character but lacking in the other elements that make a book interesting to me; action, setting, place.  As others have mentioned the middle of the book gets too bogged down in head-game thinking/telling.Half a star for NOT writing politics into the narrative as so many authors are prone to do today.  This reader/reviewer is begging them to please stop doing that.

Title: Too long
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Body: Cut 100 pages out, and you could have the same story. It was most annoying to read. But I had to for a bookclub. Most of the characters needed a smack across the back of the head.

Title: 3 stars for me
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Body: Im giving myself 3 stars for finishing this book even though i got stuck during the second third of the book and wanted to quit. Way to go Hannah for finishing.

Title: Great ending... long read
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Body: I enjoyed the storyline but felt like a lot of the details within the story were drawn out way too much.

Title: Sorry, Oprah. Not this time.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
Body: As a bibliophile, I've always appreciated Oprah's Book Club selections. I haven't wholly shared her taste in books, but I've always looked forward to seeing book recommendations from a smart, literate thought leader.Wow. Oprah and I surely weren't on the same page this time.‚ÄéAnn Napolitano is a highly skilled writer. Her words exude warmth and empathy, and her characters -- major and minor -- spring to life. I would have given her 5 stars for drawing me into the characters' inner lives and making me root for a more compelling plot, but I ended up hard-pressed to justify giving it 3 stars.Somehow, I just found this book difficult to wade through. I couldn't stay focused on the story. It wasn't the sudden onset of an attention span issue or cognition problem for me. Perhaps I was a bit distracted because of a huge breaking national news story--but, heck, we always have huge breaking national news stories, don't we? This just about never happens to me.But I failed to buy into the narrative. The characters were real, and there was character development, but it took too much time and provided almost no satisfaction by the time it happened. I forced myself to finish the book only because I felt that the payoff may have been worth it.It wasn't. For those who started to read the book, I want to warn you that there's no light at the end of the tunnel. For me, the time I invested in finishing this book would have been far better spent in joyfully reading other works. YMMV, of course.By the way, I loved "Dear Edward," by the same author. So I'd probably read another book that she wrote. But, likely, I"d borrow it from the library instead of purchasing it.

Title: Not as good as expected
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Body: It was worth the read but not on the top of the list

Title: my opinion: just ok
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Body: I might be an outsider on this. I really didn‚Äôt care for this much. Several characters were not well developed and some of the characters like Rose and Julia were just very unlike able to me. I also didn‚Äôt care for the unreal relationship between the girls. I don‚Äôt regret reading but I wouldn‚Äôt strongly recommend.
